title: The Trump Split Screen: A Peacemaker Abroad, a Retribution Campaign at Home
summary: President Trump’s dueling personas were on display this week, providing endless ammunition to his allies and his enemies alike.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff Says Trump Should Send National Guard to San Francisco
summary: Mr. Benioff, the Salesforce C.E.O. and owner of Time magazine, once supported Hillary Clinton and a business tax for homeless services. Now he’s fully behind Donald Trump.

title: Judge Signals She Is Likely to Order Abrego Garcia’s Release Soon
summary: The judge expressed frequent frustrations with the Trump administration, saying it had presented a “totally inconsistent” case to keep the Maryland man in immigration detention.

title: Strikes on Venezuelan Boats Prompt Rare U.N. Meeting on the United States
summary: The U.N. Security Council met Friday to discuss the Trump administration’s deadly attacks on what it asserts were drug smugglers in the Caribbean.

title: Trump Threatens 100% Tariffs on Chinese Goods
summary: The president made the threat after Beijing imposed new global restrictions on the use of rare earth minerals, which are vital supplies for U.S. makers of chips and batteries.

title: S&P and Nasdaq Slump as Stocks Fall on Trump China Tariff Threat
summary: The S&P 500 slumped more than 2 percent for the first time in six months, rattling investors after a long stretch of gains.

title: Gaza Cease-Fire Begins, Israel Says, as Thousands Return to the North
summary: The Israeli military’s announcement of a pause in fighting brought a mass movement of people heading home to Gaza City and its surroundings.

title: Democrats Praise Israel-Gaza Peace Deal, but Not Trump for Forging It
summary: Most Democrats left President Trump conspicuously unmentioned as they cheered a potential end to the conflict, reflecting the tricky politics around the war and their party’s deep hostility to Mr. Trump.

title: Ancient Roman Gravestone Found in New Orleans Backyard Touches Off a Mystery
summary: Nobody knew how a nearly 2,000-year-old grave marker landed in a backyard for decades — until this week.

title: How China Powers Its Electric Cars and High-Speed Trains
summary: China is building a network of ultrahigh-voltage power lines to carry solar and wind energy hundreds and even thousands of miles as few citizens dare to protest.

title: Top Justice Dept. Officials Weren’t Told in Advance of James Indictment
summary: Those in the dark included Attorney General Pam Bondi, people familiar with the matter said. The government shutdown, a rush to indict and internal divisions contributed to the lack of coordination.

title: For Mamdani and James, Twin Targets of Trump, a Political Bond Deepens
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the front-runner in the New York City mayor’s race, and Letitia James, New York’s attorney general, have a kinship shaped in part by their shared opposition to the president.

title: The Mortgage Fraud Case Against Letitia James, Explained
summary: An indictment brought by a novice prosecutor and Trump loyalists against one of the president’s foes centers on a 2020 house purchase.

title: Trump’s Retribution Revival Tour
summary: When he was running for office, Donald Trump said he’d be too busy as president to go after his enemies. He’s making time for it now.

title: Macron Reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as France’s Prime Minister
summary: President Emmanuel Macron is trying to calm the political turmoil that has gripped the country and jeopardized the passage of a budget.

title: Billions of Dollars ‘Vanished’: Low-Profile Bankruptcy Rings Alarms on Wall Street
summary: The unraveling of First Brands, a midsize auto-parts maker, is exposing hidden losses at international banks and “private credit” lenders.

title: The W.N.B.A. Gets More Attention Now. That’s Not Always a Good Thing.
summary: The league’s popularity has given rise to online sexism and racism — and misinformation that traffics in both.

title: María Corina Machado Wins Nobel Peace Prize Despite Trump’s Campaign
summary: Ms. Machado galvanized a movement that independent analysts say won last year’s election, only to have it stolen by President Nicolás Maduro.

title: In the Wake of the Edmund Fitzgerald
summary: The mighty ship, immortalized in song by Gordon Lightfoot, sank 50 years ago on Lake Superior. Our reporter spent a week on a Great Lakes freighter that survived the storm.

title: A Worthy Nobel Peace Laureate
summary: And a reminder of the need to depose the regime of Nicolás Maduro.

title: The A.I. Prompt That Could End the World
summary: A destructive A.I., like a nuclear bomb, is now a concrete possibility; the question is whether anyone will be reckless enough to build one.

title: Boston Prosecutors Invoke Law Used Against Anarchists to Charge Protesters
summary: The charges are an indication that Boston’s mayor and Police Department are telegraphing to President Trump that they’re going to come down hard on civil unrest.

title: Renato Casaro, ‘Michelangelo of Movie Posters,’ Dies at 89
summary: Few moviegoers knew his name, but directors like Sergio Leone, Sylvester Stallone and Quentin Tarantino considered his vivid work invaluable.

title: Families of Uvalde Shooting Victims Attend ‘Bittersweet’ School Opening
summary: Three years after one of the nation’s deadliest school shootings, a new campus in the city will welcome 600 new elementary students.
